definition: Hu Egong (1884-1951), Chinese revolutionary and politician
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
abbr. for Hubei Province 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] in central China/surname E

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Huang Xing (1874-1916), revolutionary politician, close collaborator of Sun Yat-sen, prominent in the 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4], murdered in Shanghai in 1916
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
Borodin (name)/Alexander Porfirevich Borodin (1833-1887), Russian chemist and composer
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
Xu Shichang (1855-1939), politician associated with the Northern Warlords, president of China in 1921

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Zhao Erxun (1844-1927), modern historian, compiled the Draft History of the Qing dynasty 清史稿
